inn1.comm: good start from Tremain. Full, but not overpitched. Slightly wide, drawing de Kock forward. No movement and solidly blocked.
this was overpitched. Pushing it fuller to invite some swing. none in the air, none off the pitch. The result a sweet on-drive back to the bowler

too straight this time, full and straight. De Kock will pick those off all day, all night. Clipped through the vacant midwicket region. To both these batsmen, the top-of-off line should be more outside off.
129 kph, full and wide outside off. Rather be here than straight. Driven to mid-off
131.4 kph, full on off. Not a bad line, not a bad length. Yet, de Kock strides forward and shovels to midwicket. Such a strong bottom hand
superb end. 135.6 kph, fullish on off. Amla stays in his crease and defends with head over ball
superb run. 131.7 kph, nagging line on off. De Kock plays it with soft hands, by his feet. Calls Amla through, who responds positive. An easy single. Real quality that
hmm, 132 kph. Good length outside off, Amla goes back to try and punch through cover. He mis-times to mid-on. Early signs of a slow surface? Amla rarely mis-hits
no, cannot be there. Poor delivery, short and wide outside off. Amla goes back, late transfer of weight onto the back foot but misses his cut.
better, 132 kph. Good length on off, may have come back in slightly. Worked to square leg, using those wrists
delectable. This one is timed to perfection. A very similar delivery to the second one, shortish and wide. Amla stays back, all his wight on the back foot and just times his square cut through point.
good comeback. gets it straighter, towards off on a good length. Amla takes his bottom hand off as he defends, some extra bounce
too straight again, easily worked past mid-on. Finch hurtles back from mid-on and puts i a boundary-saving dive. Nice work from Finch. Cannot bowl there though. Just easy for Qdk
oh my. What a shot. 129 kph, overpitched on off. Crisply driven to mid-off with the full face of the bat
there goes with the inconsistency. Amla waits for the straight delivery, gets it and then whips it off through midwicket with an ease only he can procure. Races away, quick outfield
good length on off, not a bad ball but Amla manufactures a run by working it through square leg.
tapped into the leg side, an apparent plan to keep it straight but I disagree with this process. These two too strong on the pads
too wide outside off this time, not great bowling. A half-volley outside off is pummelled to cover. Lucky to get away with that

139 kph, down leg. An easy whip off the pad through deep square leg. Keeping it along the ground, good from de Kock. Played an awful stroke last match, easy to get away with it in the Highveld, not in port Elizabeth or here.
superb. Full on a fifth-stump line. Amla shuffles across, waits for it and then slices the ball almost by opening the face discernibly late. Gets the gap at point, gets four. All class
tip and run. Full, coming back in towards off. Amla plays it through gully for one
fullish on off, pushed into the off side
better I would say. Full on off, a bit of late away movement. Still, de Kock tries to work it through midwicket but that late swing is responsible for a skew to mid-off
an appeal is quickly withdrawn. Good length on middle and leg. pitched outside leg. De Kock misses a routine flick
a half-volley. Australia's inexperienced seamers are showing it. Simple for a class batsman to just caress his drive through cover. Tear-your-hair out bowling.
still the inexperience showing. Not a bad ball to most batsmen, but it is to Amla, who shuffles across and whips a length delivery on off and middle through square leg
better. Closer to off, on a  good length. Worked to fine leg, playing it well de Kock.
okay, can't do much about that. Acceptable. Good length slightly outside off, a nice line to Amla. Sweetly-timed to mid-off
not a bad change-up. The 127 bouncer on off is too slow to trouble Amla, who has enough time to use his technique to get on top of the bounce and rolls his wrists to find one to deep square leg
another single through square leg. 127 kph. Nice lines to finish
yet again, so easy for de Kock. Just nudge a leg side delivery through square leg to get one
135 kph, this is not good bowling. Not good at all. Half-volley outside off, Amla opens the face and times his drive through extra cover.
much better. Full on off and middle, Amla bunts the ball through mid-off for an atypically quick run
ah, a dot ball to de Kock. Why? Because it's fullish and wide outside off. Better line to de Kock, driven to mid-off
good length on off, de Kock works to short fine leg. An ODI stroke

gone! Exactly where Australia should have been bowling from the start. Pushes it slightly wider, a full length on a fourth/fifth-stump line. De Kock's intention is to score and so pushes at it with hard hands. All he succeeds in doing is chipping a catch to short cover, brought there due to the lack of swing. Against the run of play
nice. 135 kph, full and straight. Nudged towards square leg
a big appeal, 130 kph. Thigh pad says the umpire. Good length down leg, Amla walks off and misses a simple nudge. He wouldn't normally miss those
130.6 kph, good length on off and middle. Blocked

big, big wicket. Mennie goes through Amla and the stumps are sent cartwheeling. What a beauty. Not sure Amla could do anything about that. Mennie goes wide of the crease, pitches this on off and middle. like most deliveries today, Amla thinks this is coming back in.  but it pitches and straightens and beats Amla's flick to clatter into off stump. To beat a batsman like Amla with a bit of swing, that's a special delivery.
good length on off, solid in defense. Head over the ball
132 kph, fullish on off. Nice lines. Pushed to cover. Wicket maiden. Sensational over.
suddenly, the lines are impeccable. Good length outside off, the ball comes back in. Du Plessis leaves, a tight leave
oh yeah. Superb. Slightly overpitched on middle and leg, easy enough to present the full face of the bat and use his bottom hand to get it past mid-on. Races away.
good call. Drags the length back, full on middle and leg. But not overpitched. Pushed towards mid-on with soft hands, calls "yes, yes" immediately.
good length outside off, not much swing. Rossouw thinks pf playing it, but withdraws late
132 kph, fullish on off, solidly kept out
overpitched outside off, 134 kph, sweetly driven to cover. Can't find the gap
good length outside off, 129 kph. Dabbed down to point. Nice lines, Mennie has been spot on
oh beaut! Good length outside off, the ball moves away and beats the bat. Faf is left hanging his bat out
135 kph, overpitched on off. Driven to mid-off. It's not wide so it's not a bad delivery
good length outside of, opens the face of his bat and angles this down to third man. Nice.
127 kph, quite close to off. Pushed to mid-on. Not extracting a lot of  movement, the lines are good enough to keep the batsmen circumspect
nope, that was overpitched. Too full on off, a simple opportunity for Rossouw to on-drive past mid-on. Superlative timing
another on-drive. 132 kph, great shot. Just too full, too straight. Faf punches his straight drive, again, the bottom hand gets it past his partner and for four
good length outside off, blocked into the off side
134 kph, good lines. Closer to outside off and full. Faf tries to force his drive, opened up his stance a touch. Into the ground and to short cover
good length outside off, 132 kph. Steered down to third man
135 kph, good length on off. Rossouw runs down and hits it back to the bowler
nicely played. Good length outside off, 133 kph. Hit on the up to extra cover
129 kph, good length on middle. Pushed down to mid-on. Better line
131 kph, good length on off. Dabbed down to backward point. Nagging away are these Aus bowlers now
shortish outside off, 129 kph. Brings it back in. Slapped to cover, improperly timed
133 kph, overpitched on off. Yorker almost. Jammed out to mid-on
132 kph, good length outside off, patted into the off side. Really good bowling now. Not giving away much

another one! Faf troubled with some nagging lines attempts an exuberant lofted drive, but the ball pitches on off and moves back in. Not prodigious but enough and beats Faf's inside edge and take the top of off and middle. Faf undone by pressure and the movement, both equally responsible for the wicket
ooh, mis-field. Very un-Australian. Full and wide outside off, too much width. Rossouw thrashes his drive straight to extra cover who lets it go through. Trav Head
good comeback. Good length outside off, tapped towards backward point
134 kph, overpitched outside off. Driven to mid-off
good length on off, 135.6 kph. Nudged towards square leg
good length towards off. Punched from the back foot to mid-on
good length on middle and leg, 131 kph. Nudged away into the leg side, towards wide mid-on
overpitched from Mennie. From around the wicket, bowls it full outside off. Rossouw strides forward and hits his cover drive into the ground, whistles away over cover
walks across to clip through square leg. The fielder sprints to his left to cut it off
oh my. Another sensational stroke. Too full on off, Rossouw stays forward, gets the length and then just presens the full face to time his drive through mid-off. Beautiful
good length on off, pushed away towards mid-on
good length outside off, quietly played into the off side
looking to hit that too hard. 121 kph, slower delivery outside off. Rossouw wanted to muscle that past mid-on but skewed his stroke to mid-on from the inside half of his bat

oh yes. Another superb drive. Marsh starts it with a freebie, full and wide outside off. Duminy laces his cover drive past extra cover. Too much width, too full. Just easy, even for a batsman playing his first ball
still too full, brought this closer to off through. Driven to the man at cover
through again, four more. Good length outside off, Duminy plays this on the up. Gets it through the gap at cover. Short cover and extra cover left sprawling by perfect placement
rubbish. A low full toss outside off, Duminy stays in his crease and then carves the full toss into the ground and then over point
sloppy! Awful stuff from Australia. Full outside off, pushed to short cover. Somehow, he lets it go through and concedes the run
four more! 17 off Marsh's first. Too full on off. Rossouw belts his straight drive past the stumps. Holds his pose and he gets four.
good length outside off, 130 kph. Left alone nicely
good length on middle, 131 kph. Solidly blocked. Well played
137 kph, Mennie has been good today. Very tight around off, defended
good length on off, no room for Duminy and so all he can do is defend into the off side
lovely shot. A decent change-up. Short on off, Duminy rolls his wrists, gets over the ball and places it perfectly behind square.
good length on middle, blocked
slides one down the leg side, keeper does well to half-stop that
drifting into the pads, tucked behind square leg for a quick single
floats it full on middle, Duminy gets a good stride forward to defend it back to the bowler
driven with the spin to long-off
eased with the spin to long-off
turns it with the angle to the man at short fine leg
loopy delivery on middle stump, tapped gently to the off side. Steady over
hit on the up, just past George Bailey at short cover. Mitch Marsh can't believe his luck
some inward movement from around the stumps, dabbed gently towards where a short third man would be
floats a full delivery into middle and leg, he plays back to a delivery he could have pushed forward, no damage done in the end
firm drive but straight to the skipper at extra cover

clears his front leg and hammers that into the wide long-on boundary. That  isn't to say it was a slog. It was a shimmy down the pitch, didn't get to the pitch alright, but he still went through with the bat to muscle that over the ropes. Top hit
nurdles it behind square leg for a quick sigle
picks the length early and rocks back to cut, can't split the field on the off side, straight to point
plays a delicate little dab to point
too full on the pads, worked with the angle to deep midwicket, 100 up for the hosts
gives it generous flight and lands it on middle, driven with the spin to cover
fires one into the pads, the direction is wrong. Duminy misses a fine paddle too
drops it gently into the off side towards cover point for a quick single
gets to the pitch of the ball and works it down the ground to long-on
punches a length ball straight to cover
bangs this one it at length on middle and leg, Rossouw simply taps it gently to the off side and scoots across for a run. Mere eye contact and they were off.
attempts to slap that on the up past cover but ends up chopping it wide of the keeper, who runs to his left and fires a throw at the bowler's end. Nearly took Mitch Marsh off with it
drilled down the ground to long-off

check drive but boy, he's hit it superbly. Into the gap at deep extra cover. Not sure why he was apprehensive. The ball may have held up just a little, but he adjusted well. Good timing, better placement
leans forward and thumps an overpitched delivery straight to cover
there was a point and cover, but he opens up the off side and plays a delightful cover drive with the spin to pick the gap.
too easy again, full and wide outside off, makes a bit of room and drives inside-out into the gap at deep extra cover
steered straight to backward point
plants forward and dabs the in-drifter to the off side
width and he's hammered that into the cover boundary. Drags it short, enough width as well for Rossouw to rock back and slap that off the back foot. He'll crunch those for breakfast, lunch and dinner
sensible stuff. Boundary followed by a single as he taps it towards the man coming in from the edge of the circle at cover
turns the back of length delivery on middle to square leg
gentle push off the back foot into the point region for a quick ingle
hint of away movement from the length area on middle, he doesn't get the kind of room he's looking for, ends up defending it straight to point. Looks like he wanted to run it down to third man
floats it full on the pads, flicked straight to midwicket
slower and fuller on middle, Rossouw gets an inside edge to the right of the keeper as he looks to tap and run
stays back inside the crease and defends to the leg side
starts off with a superbly tossed up delivery that draws Rossouw forward, he blocks with a straight bat
sliced to Finch at deep cover. He was looking to hit it over mid-off, but didn't get to the pitch of the ball. The ball drifted away as well as the bat face opened
steps out and works it with the spin to wide long-on. He saw the batsman advancing and dropped it shorter, but couldn't prevent the single
wayward this time, slides this down leg, flicked firmly towards deep square. Slips has he turns for the second, so stays put and soaks in the applause of the crowd. 8th ODI fifty
flatter one on middle, punched back to the bowler
slow turn from middle and leg, tucked behind square for an easy single
length ball on middle and leg, he hops across and tickles it down to fine leg
short and punished. There's a big, big gap at deep square leg and he's pulled him imperiously. The attempted bouncer gone wrong as he rolled his wrists superbly to get the placement right
dabbed to the man coming in from point
walks across the stumps to turn that away-going delivery to midwicket
slashes and gets a thick edge down to third man
stays inside the crease and opens the bat face late to run it down for an easy single
full toss on middle, worked to wide-long on Happy to chance the second and it looks like they'e back for it quite comfortably. Rossouw dished in a full-length dive to complete it.
slider outside off, he stays back and cuts that behind point. Wasn't all that short, but the timing and placement was simply sensational
stretches forward and defends
slow turn back in, but it was bowled full to aid Duminy's deadbat defense
worked wide of midwicket for a quick single
drops it short again, Rossouw makes a bit of room and cracks that towards deep extra cover. The timing was just a wee bit off, but the placement was spot on again
walks down the pitch and heaves a length ball across the line towards cow corner. It was the bigger boundary too, but he didn't get it anywhere near the middle. Finch did the mopping up
gets forward and gently dabs the back of length delivery on middle and off
worked off his pad towards square leg
that has been blasted into the backward point boundary at the rate of knots. Sitting up nicely for him to open his wrists and slap that behind point. Super execution
touch and run. Bowler went across to stop that but the non-striker was off the blocks almost immediately after the batsman tapped it. That he had to run diagonally didn't hurt either
firm push to mid-off, who is a touch deep. Easiest of singles taken
gets it wrong, too short and down leg. Duminy looks to whip it fine but misses
tossed up on the pads, turned behind square leg
gets a good stride in to defend that tossed up delivery
that's  gift which has been gleefully accepted. High full toss on middle and leg, he generated the power through his swing to deposit that deep into the stands at deep midwicket
gets to the pitch of the ball and works it with the spin to long on
tossed up outside leg stump, tucked to where a traditional square leg fielder would be, keeper runs across to cut that off
nurdled behind square again, too easy as they pinch another run
low full toss outside off, drilled to sweeper cover
pulled in front of square as he rolls his wrists nicely, straight to deep square
this time he toe-ends an attempted pull over midwicket.  Cry of anguish from the batsman.  Played too early
stands tall and punches it down to long-off
uppish but into the gap between deep square and fine leg. He used the depth of the crease to whip that
gets the direction of that short delivery wrong, well down the leg side as Duminy misses the pull
drops it gently behind square on the off side, point runs to his right to cut that off
leans forward and deadbats that tossed up delivery on middle
squeezed down to long-off. Too full, he looked to hit it past cover
makes a bit of room and crunches the short ball towards deep cover
touch short, whipped to deep midwicket
shapes to pull but the ball cuts back in to cramp him for room, bunted to long-on through a short-arm jab
mistimes a slog but still manages to pinch the gap between deep midwicket and long-on
slow turn from middle, eased wide of cover
can't get any bat on that attempted tickle down leg side, hit on the pad
punched down to long-on as they jog the single
drifter into middle and leg, he looks to play down the ground but the ball rolls off a thick inside edge to deep midwicket
slapped to cover, where Smith dives full length to his left to half-stop that and deflect that to long-off.  Saved three runs
fires one down leg, well stopped by the keeper
drops it gently towards backward point for a quick single
worked down the ground towards long-on.  JP is back with a crucial knock
thick inside-edge back down the pitch as he shapes to drive
driven across the line to long-off
flatter one on middle and leg, tucked to square leg
looks to biff that across the line but is made to reach out, hit straight to cover instead
wrong'un on middle, punched to long-on
flight from Head outside off, Duminy drives with the spin to long-off
tossed up on leg, drilled to long-on
tripe from Head. Flat down leg, Duminy sweeps past past short fine leg. All he had to do was get some bat on that, and it races away past the fielder
shortish on off, slapped to deep point from the crease
another darter on off, Rossouw looks to cut and he inside edges towards the keeper. No spin, too close to cut
nudged to midwicket
good length on off, nice and tight around off. Duminy plays it by his feet.
overpitched outside off, steered in the gap to sweeper cover
good length outside off, 136 kph. Punched to long-off. Rossouw seems to have settled down nicely, very nicely
133 kph, fullish length on off from around the wicket. Driven back, cramping JP for room
136 kph, full on off. Driven to cover.
fuller than a good length on off and middle. Defended to cover
good length on middle, nice lines. Blocked back
yorker on off, goes wide of the crease. 134 kph. Jammed out
good length on middle, Rossouw has had enough of plodding about. Wants to open his arms but can only pat it back to midwicket
good length on middle, pushed towards cover. Very good lines these, not giving Rossouw anything. Pressure building
fullish on middle and leg, Rossouw wanted to go straight but skewed the ball to deep square leg instead
low full toss on middle and leg, some swing in the air. Drilled to mid-on. Just one off the over, exceptional over
good length outside off, slapped to deep cover. Timing is superlative. Cracked that straight to the fielder
full and straight, 133 kph. Nudged away towards midwicket
good length outside off, chopped down to third man with the angled bat

pulled to the long-off boundary. This is how much modern batting has improved. Shortish length outside off, Rossouw shimmied down looking to go over midwicket. Wasn't close to playing that shot, so he drilled it down to long-off with unbelievable timing
good length on middle and leg, kept out
128 kph, good length outside off. Pushed to cover
superb batting from JP. Gets an offcutter on middle and leg, JP rushes down, meets the ball and lofts it over mid-on with nonchalant ease.

oh my. Things are going from worse to unbearable. Full outside off, driven straight to mid-off. Duminy calls for one immediately. Mennie is quick to the ball, but lifts his eyes while collecting and the ball goes straight through. And to the boundary. Raucous, sarcastic cheers.
bouncer on off and middle, pulled towards square leg
well run, good length down leg, nudged towards backward square. Played that with soft hands, enabling them to get back for two
137 kph, fullish outside off. Driven down to long-off
short delivery, another bouncer. Duminy gets under that. Another superb over for SA

picked the length early, gets it and latches onto the short delivery. Drops short at medium pace, Rossouw pulls it emphatically, played it early to get it in front of square. Marsh has been awful today
full on off, driven to long-off
good length outside off, steered down to third man. Very nice from JP
bouncer on off, Rossouw gets underneath that. Good change-up from Marsh
short and wide outside off, more tripe. Scythed to deep cover.
shortish on off, 135 kph. Pulled to deep square leg, rolled his wrists on that to keep it down
good length down leg, Duminy misses his flick but the ball pings off the pad and ricochets away for four leg byes
full outside off, pushed to cover
overpitched on middle, beautifully driven to long-on. Straight face
good length on middle, blocked
full on middle and off, Rossouw opens his stance slightly and drives to long-off. One closer
good length outside off, 130 kph. Dabbed down to third man
short and wide outside off, 137 kph. Played away to deep point.
Rossouw advances, Boland sees it early, shortens the length and forces Rossouw to bail out of the stroke
short and wide outside off, hit on the up but straight to cover
nudged towards short fine leg, slowish delivery down leg
wide called. Bouncer on off, Duminy sways out of the line. A tad too high feels the square leg umpire
slow on middle, worked into the leg side
another cutter on off, pushed away towards cover
131 kph, full outside off, crisply driven to long-off to move to 99

out! Soft dismissal. Duminy falls. A rather selfless stroke. Full and wide outside off, Duminy wanted to open the face to drive towards deep cover in order to get Rossouw back on strike. Instead, carves a ball to backward point because the ball is too wide to fetch and hit that much in front of square. Quality, quality knock from JP. Hardly mis-hit a ball
shortish delivery down leg, nudged down to fine leg. Attacking those ribs, Miller upto it
well bowled, 130 kph. Bouncer on off, Rossouw sways out of the line. Well played too, a good ball is allowed to be kept out

gets it this time. Fist-pumping his way to the other end. Delight, joy, exhilaration. Another quality innings from Rossouw. A short delivery is pulled to deep square leg to get to his 3rd ODI ton, a serious knock this. And under pressure too. Complete transfer of momentum
good length outside off, played down to point
slapped for four. Easy for Rossouw. He shimmies down, a natural improvisation from the bowler to drop short and Rossouw pummels his slap past mid-off. Great batting
advances again, Boland goes short again but with more fury and annoyance. Forces Rossouw out of the stroke
slower delivery outside off, dabbed down to third man from the crease.
wild swing. Rossouw still has an important role here. Lots of overs still. Short outside off, Rossouw comes down and swings, but misses
that deserved to go, good shot selection too. Short down leg, sits up for Rossouw to pull to the deep square leg boundary. Head gets across but can't pull it in
shimmies down again, Boland drops short and Rossouw flat-bats his slap to cover
shapes to pull but the ball keeps low to beat him to the stroke and thud into the thigh
dabbed wide of point for an easy single
worked off his hip to midwicket, they chance a risky single and get it
teaser for third man, but he had no chance on this fast outfield. Deft little touch from Miller. Not known for it, maybe he surprised himself. Superbly done
leading edge flies down to third man again. Closed the bat face early and saw the ball get big on him
backs away and pierces a packed off side field. Short third man and point were in place to prevent the slash, but to no avail as he freed his arms and picked the gap
turned with the angle to deep midwicket
slapped to cover where Smith dives to is right to pull off a one-handed stop
missed the flick, the keeper was blinded too and it runs down towards fine leg
punched to deep midwicket
tossed up on middle, worked across the line towards deep midwicket
paddles that, but the ball flies off a top-edge, fortunately no one positioned straight behind the wicketkeeper
gets a thick inside edge to short fine, it was an attempted biff over deep midwicket
swing and a miss. Floated at length outside off, he stepped out to go inside-out over cover, but played too early. Perhaps gave away his intention quickly too
digs one in short, swivels back and helps it down to fine leg
another wild swing but can only toe-end it down to long-on
punches a length ball on the up to sweeper cover
bowler floats it full and wide outside off, batsman reaches out to squeeze that behind point
gets a thick inside edge down to long-on even as he tries to go inside-out over cover, the fielder was caught napping an they scamper back for the second. Smith won't be pleased
steps out and turns it across the line to square leg
backs away to steer that one towards deep point
uppish but over the top to find the fence in the deep. It was fired full and flat outside off, Rossouw backed away to free his arms and smear that into the gap
steps out, the bowler fires it into the pads, worked to deep square
uppish and straight to the man at the edge of the circle at cover
top effort by Zampa at third man to cut that off. Miller got down low and opened the bat face late to squeeze that full delivery into the gap

short and he's helped it along into the deep backward square leg boundary. He'll pick those away even if he's woken up to play that in the middle of his sleep. It was sitting up nicely for him to execute it too.
chopped to the keeper, wanted to guide it down to third man but the ball nipped back in a wee bit from length
pulled, this time in front of square to Finch at deep midwicket

slogged across the line, and he's holed out to Mitch Marsh at long-on. It was the slower one which he didn't completely get underneath and only managed to skew it off the bottom half of the bat. He knew immediately that it wasn't timed well. Rossouw walks off to a round of applause, this has been a super knock
chopped to short third man again, too close to cut
fired full on off, pushed to cover
slides one into middle from around the stumps, defended off the back foot
worked with the angle to wide long-on
drifting into the pads, wristed to wide long-on again
stretches forward and eases it to cover for a quick single
punched down to long-off, sensible stuff
sliced to point, but Bailey can only half-stop that to concede a single
eased down to third man for an easy single

brilliant effort by Zampa at third man keeps that to two. Got a thick edge off a wild swing, he wanted to hit it over cover but it was a slower delivery as well, which meant he had to generate all the power
back-of-the-hand slower delivery that has been slapped into the gap at deep extra cover, Travis Head with a sliding stop. If he was hoping for some relief after all that bowling, not to be
another back-of-the-hand slower one that goes horribly wrong and slips outside the side line. Keeper collects on the bounce
short and wide outside off, bunted wide of cover
nips back in from outside off, deflected down to third man
he's clobbered that into the stands at deep midwicket. He set himself for that biff and the short ball merely aided him as he swung across the line to generate the power
drilled down to long-on. Much fuller this time from the bowler
helped into the fine leg boundary. Short delivery down leg and Miller just flicked that nonchalantly behind square
squeezed to long-off this time
super delivery. Death rattle. This is full and straight on middle, he looks to back away and squeeze that behind point but the ball clattered into the stumps off a very fine inside-edge.
low full toss, eased down to long-off
hurried for pace by a short delivery on middle, he gets on top of the bounce and dabs it to the off side
nips back in to beat the inside edge and deflect off the pad to short third man

picks out Steven Smith at deep cover. Looked like he wanted to hit it to wide long-off but stiff breeze may have played part in him not hitting it where it wanted. It was a slower delivery too, which made it all the more tougher for Miller. Useful knock nonetheless
rip roaring bouncer first up, Abbott sways out of the way but umpire deems it a little too high.  Touched close to 140 clicks with that

pokes at that without any conviction and the thick edge has been well taken by Wade, who dives full-length forward to complete the low catch. Third umpire was called for and replays only confirmed Wade's belief.
swing and a miss. Looked to back away and slap that over point
squirted over backward point. Looked to go over cover, but he still gets the desired result. The ball flew off a thick edge. Useful runs
drilled down to long-off, on the bounce to Finch. Struck that sweetly
follows the batsman by spearing a yorker that cramps Steyn for room, but Wade, who is perhaps unsighted, makes a mess of that as it deflects to the fine leg boundary
low full toss that has been swung across the line to deep midwicket
he's hit that into Durban or what? Length ball on middle, Rabada is down on one knee as he swings across to send that soaring way over the deep midwicket boundary. Wow
squeezed to cover, excellent yorker on that occasion
gets a thick inside edge off a wild slog, straight to deep square

inn2.comm: good length down leg, a little bit of inswing. Hits Warner on the thigh and then trickles towards the keeper
136 kph, good length outside off, some swing. Not a lot. Left alone. Good from Finch, has to take a bit of time
good length outside off, 137 kph. Finch brings his bat down from gully and defends.
beautiful bowling this. Pushes this fuller outside off, the ball jags back in and hits Finch on the pad just outside off. Very similar to his dismissal in P.E
lovely lines. 132 kph, full outside off. Left alone, respectfully, yet confidently
another good length delivery outside off, just a hint of away swing and Finch leaves again. Great start from Abbott
back of a length down leg, 132 kph. Nice length that, getting Warner to hop about. Worked away towards backward square
waaaaaay down leg. 136 kph, needs a big dive from de Kock to prevent byes
good length on middle and off, wonderful lengths and lines to Finch. He can do nothing but defend
yes, quality single. Good length on off, offering nothing are the opening bowlers so Finch pushes towards mid-off and calls for one. Well done.
through the off-side infield. Short and wide outside off, Warner stands tall and scythes a cut past point. A hand from JP Duminy prevents the boundary
141 kph. Good length on off, moves this away. Warner pushes into the off side and then yelps "noo"
144 kph, getting quicker and quicker is KG. Overpitched outside off, sweetly hit to mid-off
quite full outside off, Finch sees an opportunity and chooses to go over the infield. Doesn't quite get it where he wanted, skews it over point for a couple. Got enough to clear the fielder
136 kph, good length outside off, pushed towards mid-on
short and wide, not Abbott's best. Was there to be punished but Finch finds point with his cut
gets it in the gap this time. Short and wide yet again from Abbott, Finch plays this earlier and finds the gap in front of point (more towards cover point).
beauty from Abbott. Wonderful comeback. Good length outside off, draws Finch forward and then beats him with just enough outswing. Jaffa
135 kph, nice comeback. Continues to persist with a fullish length around off. Finch inside-edges onto his pad
141 kph, hustling Warner for pace. Nice bowling, I'd rather be there than wide to Warner. Cramps him for room, leg side-ish. Warner is hit on the thigh pad
144 kph, too short. The bouncer on off. Yes, it's quick, but it comes much slower off the pitch and so Warner pulls easily over square leg
139 kph, good length on off. Pushed into the off side. Good contest this
keeping it close to the stumps. Very good bowling, blocked into the off side
143 kph, overpitched outside off, squeezed to third man with an angled bat
good end. A tight length around off, punched to cover.
too short. Short of a length down leg, Warner whips it away to fine leg for one.
132 kph, good length on middle, shovelled to midwicket

ooh, maybe not wide enough to play that stroke. Fullish length outside off, Finch stays in his crease and tries to punch through cover, but the ball comes back enough to take the inside edge onto the pad
133 kph, superb stuff. Sticks with a good length, gets enough away movement to beat the bat. Beautiful bowling
and again, 135 kph. Good length outside off, away swing and Finch's beaten.
133 kph, fullish outside off, blocked towards mid-off

lovely running. Even better batting. Good length on off and middle, absolutely nothing wrong with that. Warner's technique is such that he always stays leg side of the ball to find gaps through the off side. He opens the face this time and finds the gap behind point for two
good length on middle, blocked
ooh, width. 140 kph, outside off. The ball moves away late. Warner swished and missed. Wanted to go straight past the bowler

dropped. 138 kph, good length on off. Warner, with his leg side technique, tries to dab one down to third man. He ends up steering one straight to Amla at wide slip. Quinton de Kock, through, dives away to his right and spills a very tough chance. Definitely Amla's catch
pushed to mid-on. 145 ks, a throw to the non-strikers end ends up in overthrows, one
good length around off. Blocked. Good stuff from Finch, playing this testing period out
what respite. My word, what a greeting. Shortish outside off, Warner sees the length early and then pulls through midwicket with disdain. Cross-seam from Steyn.
137 kph, good length down leg, Warner tries to nudge into the leg side but pops back a leading edge
and again. Not very short - on middle and leg. Warner was waiting for that, gets the length he wanted and swatted Steyn through midwicket. In the vacant region and four more
more runs. Fantastic batting from Warner. Good length outside off, Warner backs away, giving himself room and lofts the ball over mid-off. Didn't bother keeping it down.
good length on middle, Warner wanted to keep that out or dab one to third man but gets a bit of inswing. Inside edged onto the pad
worked into the leg side where Amla is stationed. Warner wanted one, Amla is quick on it but lobs his throw back. A better fielder and a direct hit would have had FInch
shovelled for four. Hmm. Interesting. Overpitched on off, Warner cleared his leg and looked to go straight but the ball skews off the inside half and races away through midwicket for four.
four more. Sloppy fielding and Warner gets four more. Shortish and wide outside off, pushed straight towards extra cover where Phehlukwayo just lets it go through
just wide of Duminy. Shortish and wide, Warner wanted to go over point but just about manages to get it past Duminy
ooh, snorter. Smell that. Back of a length on off, the angle gets this back to Warner who gets his hands up and fends to point. Fantastic contest
no ball and four runs. Short down leg is Rabada, Warner helps it along to the fine leg boundary. Easy
144 kph, full toss on leg. Warner backs away and squeezes this down to third man
good length on off to finish. Hitting 140 kph consistently. Blocked by Finch
full and straight from Steyn, better. Driven back to the bowler
slower cutter down leg, nudged to deep square leg for a single
back of a length outside off, very tight to Finch who pushes to mid-off from the back foot
nice from Finch. Back of a length outside off, pushed out to mid-on who is slightly deep. Despite being on the back foot. Finch makes the run easily
a slower delivery outside off, played to cover. Good changes in pace from Steyn
good end. Another cutter on off, tapped towards point. A tight over, tight lines
good length outside off, maybe a tad too much width? Finch punches but finds extra cover

oh what a shot. And it finds the gap at wide mid-off. Back of a length outside off, natural stroke-making would indicate the ball shouldn't be going there. He stays back and muscles a punch past cover and mid-off
short, wide and put away. Finch stands tall and nails his slap to the other side of cover this time. Runs leaking
good length down leg, worked away towards midwicket
good length outside off, 130 ks. Pushed to cover
end of a fantastic Powerplay for Australia. Short and wide outside off, scythed to point.
full outside off, Warner comes down and shovels his swat to deep square leg
good length outside off, pushed to deep cover for a single. A good single. 144 kph
full on off, lovely channels. Blocked by Warner

big, big appeal. no, says the umpire Joel Wilson. Big inside edge, but the umpire didn't think so because he signalled leg byes. Fullish on leg, Warner smashes the ball into his pad and a run to third man ensues
nice lines, gets a bit of movement but Finch blocks
good end. Back of a length outside off at 143 kph. Pushed towards cover
good length on off, superb channel this. 132 kph, defended into the cover region
gives himself room and creates more width than there was. Shortish outside off, cut down to third man

dropped. Almost a sensational catch from Steyn. Short and wide from Abbott, not a good delivery, but Finch cuts. Some extra bounce leads to a thick top edge which flies down to Steyn at third man. Steyn thought it was a tougher catch that it was, ran in and sideways, got there and the ball bounces out. Great effort, Steyn underestimated his own athletic prowess
good length on middle and leg, played into the leg side
shortish delivery and straight, flat-batted swat to deep square leg

phew, how did that miss? Almost another typical Finch dismissal. Abbott can't believe it. Full length outside off, Finch wants to go straight down, over mid-on, but the ball swings back in and somehow misses off stump
good from Steyn. Full on middle, pushed back to Steyn
gets through and that will be four. Overpitched outside off, Warner forces his drive through cover and gets four. Fantastic timing. Rossouw hustles across from sweeper cover but the work is too much
good from Warner. Full and straight, pushed down to long-on
138 kph, change in length. Shortish length on off, Finch is beaten and the ball pings off his body towards the keeper
another back of a length delivery at 136 kph. Finch pulls down to fine leg. A bit uppish but didn't get enough on that
good length on off, 137 kph. Steered to point
flatter delivery on leg, played away towards midwicket
big appeal, but that clearly struck him outside off. Flight outside off from Tahir, Finch gets low and looks to sweep but inside-edges onto his pad
googly on middle and leg, Finch goes back, doesn't quite pick it and pushes to cover

gone this time! And Tahir sets off on his celebratory run. May have been the flipper, out the front of the hand. Short delivery, and quick on middle. Finch goes back, looks to cut, but clearly misjudged plenty in that - pace, length and shot selection. The ball skids through and beats Finch's cut to clatter into the stumps. Not nearly short enough to cut
beautiful, slow through the air but gets the ball to skid. Smith waits and then is hustled as he blocks

two in three. SA's players run behind Tahir. Another wicket, another lovely show of deception. Again, fuller and quicker. No turn at all. Smith goes back, looks to drive but just plain misses a straight one. Smudge gone for nothing. Beats the batsman in a lack of flight and a change up in pace, literally.
good length on leg, nudged towards midwicket for a run. Warner brings up his fifty. This has been a superb knock from him. Weill need to double this, at least
almost chopped on. Shortish and wide, comes back in. Bailey inside-edges to the keeper
full and wide outside off, steered towards point
short and wide outside off, 134 kph. Too much width, slashed to deep cover. Got on top of the bounce
good length on middle and off, worked away towards point
fullish and wide outside off, pushed back. Mis-timed.
gets forward and defends the tossed up delivery on middle
wrong'un but he has the line well covered as he smothers the spin
touch short, he rocks back to punch one to mid-on
tosses it up nicely, inviting Warner to go over the top, but he's happy to block
leading edge but lands short of short third man. Warner didn't pick the googly and looked to work it across the line over midwicket
pushes it through quicker and fuller outside off, Warner defends from the crease
floats this at length on middle from wide of the crease, the ball keeps a touch low but Bailey is behind the line as he blocks

drags it back onto the stumps and the roar tells you the story. This is reward for accuracy. This one's bowled a touch fuller from the length area, Bailey is caught on the crease as he pokes tentatively away from the body. The BALL wobbles  wee bit to take the inside edge onto the stumps.
driven on the up but straight to backward point
gets this to jag away from outside off, Marsh hops back to bunt that to point
gets on top of the bounce and dabs the short delivery to the off side
rooted to the crease as he plays back to a full delivery on off stump. Hit straight to point
slow turn back in, tapped gently to point for a quick single. Risky, but Rabada's throw was wayward
googly first up for Mitch Marsh, he gets forward and drives it straight to cover
drifting into the pads, worked to long-on
beaten by a superb googly. Warner looks to open the bat face late to slap that past cover, but was deceived in flight
beaten again,  another googly that does him in the air.  This is outstanding legspin bowling
checks his drive this time to a slider on off stump
uppish but safe, flies off the thick edge to third man
pulled but the ball wasn't all that short for him to wind up like the way he did, mistimed to deep midwicket
flicked, but finds deep square leg. Her had to come around a fair bit which gave Marsh an opportunity to amble back for the second
length ball at 134kph, Marsh hops back and punches that to cover
this one's floated a touch fuller from length outside off, Marsh defends from the crease
the bowler does well to react quickly on his followthrough to stop that rocket drive with his boot
fizzes straight on from middle, Warner gets back and blocks
driven through the line to wide long-off, much more authority in the stroke this time
wrong'un that lands outside off to draw Marsh forward, he deadbats it in the end
this one spins away, Marsh doesn't get to the pitch of the ball but manages to bunt that to cover
too full outside off, drilled across the line to Steyn at long-on, quality work to slide across to stop that
gets to the pitch of the ball and drives to deep cover
hint of width, crunched to sweeper cover
quality stroke, punched off the back foot to Tahir at deep cover
slower length ball on leg stump, nurdled to square leg
gloves a pull down to fine leg. Beaten for pace on that occasion even though he got into a relatively good position
worked off the pad to midwicket where Miller dives full length to his right to stop that lovely little flick
deflects off the pad to the leg side as he looks to tickle it fine
leans forward and blocks
makes a bit of room and punches that googly to deep cover
drifting full into the pads, eased to long-on

lofted, and lofted very nicely. Almost shoveled that off the front foot. The bat face just turned a wee bit when he made contact but he still placed it where he wanted to. The power of the bottom hand
stretches forward and defends gently
sharp turn back in from off stump, Warner uses the depth of the crease to defend
ill-directed short ball outside leg stump, batsman lets it go

quality stroke. Nothing wrong with the delivery really. It was a length ball that nipped away from off, just a hint of width, Marsh stood tall to get on top of the bounce and punched that behind point
crunching cover drive, Tahir does well to come around the ropes to restrict that to a single
whipped off his hip into the deep square leg boundary. Too straight and short, Warner once again uses the depth of the crease before bringing his powerful wrists into play
slower and fuller on the pads, clipped to short fine where Behardien nearly over-ran the ball
driven back straight to mid-on
whipped away towards deep backward square again, end of a wayward over
pushes one quicker on middle, he jams his bat down in time to bunt it back down the pitch
worked uppishly to deep midwicket
this one spins back in, Warner whips that to deep square leg
drives, but gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
touch short, punched to sweeper cover
tucked towards the man coming in from square leg
imperious pull. What a welcome to the bowling crease. Touch short and Warner was onto it in a jiffy as he pulled him in front of square
this time he nurdles that full ball to midwicket
cut away behind point, Rossouw is quickly off the blocks
hint of away-movement off the seam, punches the length ball to cover
this one grips the surface and holds up, Marsh through with his attempted punch, the ball rolls to cover
quality stroke, once again not afraid to hit on the up, the bat face is turned ever-so-slightly to beat point, the boundary rider comes around

Palmed over the ropes by Abbott at deep square leg.  But let me tell you it was a tough chance. This was short and angling in, Marsh decided he's going to pull, got good enough bat on it too. Had Abbott been on the ropes, it would have been straight down his throat.

confusion, confusion!  Marsh is ball-watching as he bunts it to point, Warner had almost completed the run even as Marsh was halfway down the pitch. A direct hit at the bowler's end would have nailed him. Duminy the fielder in question, would have been close at both ends
plays a short-arm jab to midwicket
this is an even better stroke. Short and angling in, he swivels back, gets underneath it and pulls him into the fine leg boundary. Total control
punched on the up to mid-off
hops back to bunt that full delivery to cover
edged, but safe. Down to Steyn at third man.  Oh, he's back
clubbed into the midwicket boundary. Drags a short ball outside off, Marsh sets himself up to slap that in front of square. Into position so quickly too
beaten by a nothing shot. Pokes away from the body with an angled bat
flayed on the up to Tahir at sweeper cover
beaten by a ripper! This one jags away from length on middle to square Warner up. The bounce on that too! Phew
whipped off his hip into the gap at deep square leg. Warner called for two and made it back quite easily
much better the length from Rabada, touch fuller on off stump, defended

so the decision to persist with Rabada despite an ordinary last over has worked. And he's got the man who hit him for two sixes in the previous over. This one veers back in full from wide of the crease, Marsh looks to heave it across the line, more towards midwicket, but he swings too early as the ball deflects off the pad onto the stumps
rip roaring short ball that climbs to hit his glove as he hops back to defend
opens the bat face to punch that, but JP Duminy is super agile. Throws himself to his left to stop that certain boundary
gets on top of the bounce and bunts it to the leg side
top shot! Balance, timing, wrist work and placement - all in sync as it races into the midwicket boundary. Too full from Rabada and he was punished on that occasion
drilled to cover, a half-stop gives Warner a single
stretches forward and defends that in-drifter
eased back past the bowler to long-on
that has been hammered into the gap over cover. JP gives it air, Warner is down on one knee quickly as he lofts it cleanly over the infield
Miller dives to his right to half-stop that slap, deflects to the boundary rider. That's how powerfully it was struck.  Both batsmen collided in the middle
driven wide of Miller, with the spin, for an easy single
ripper of a delivery that squares Head up. Wasn't far from the outside edge
beaten again. This one nips away off the seam from the length area on middle. Another feeble push
arches back and helps it up and over the cordon, one bounce to third man
finds the gap and the timing on that is magnificent. Hops back and then simply opens the face of the bat to steer that behind point. Third man, even though square, had no chance
pushed straight to a diving Faf du Plessis at cover

flayed into the extra cover boundary. It was hit so hard that JP Duminy, normally a very very safe fielder, had little time to react. He had no more than 5 metres to move to his right. What power! This isn't over yet
good length on middle and worked away towards midwicket. Cramping him for room
a big appeal, not given by ump Joel Wilson. Full and straight, Head misses and is rapped on the pad. May have pitched outside leg
good length on middle, 130.2 kph. Pushed towards mid-on for one.

four more. A slower ball on Warner's thighs. You may want to bowl elsewhere to him. He wanted to put that onto the banks, but got more of the inside half of the bat, sending the ball past short fine leg. Warner on 95
full on middle, 132 kph. Pushed to cover.

absolute rubbish from Phehlukwayo. Warner takes full toll. Slow offcutter well down leg. Warner just helps it along to the fine leg boundary. Would have been wide had he not got bat on that. Moves to 99.
full and wide at 136 kph. Head doesn't back down, looks to go down the ground but misses. Big swing, big miss
crashed away through cover for one.
doesn't quite get there. Overpitched from Steyn outside off, Warner picks the right stroke and drives to cover. Can't pierce the gap
100 for Warner. Subdued in celebration. Takes off his helmet and acknowledges the applause. Full on leg, pushed to mid-on and calls for one immediately. Easy. Take a bow, splendid innings
ah poor ball. Full and wide outside off, too much wifdth. Head throws his hands at that and gets it over point. Another boundary
rather full outside off, crisply driven to mid-off
132 kph, bad lines these. Not good. Down leg and Warner misses the freebie. Rapped on the pad
and again, down leg. 129 kph. Warner picks it off, clips to fine leg. Not great bowling this
129 kph, better line. Full but on middle and off. Head inside edges onto his pad. Had he missed that, he was plumb. A bit of inward movement too.
131 kph, seems pretty good to Head but loses his line to Warner. Straight on a good length, no room and so Head works to midwicket
superb as usual from Faf. Wristily nudged to Faf at midwicket who puts in a dive. may have saved at least one there
just not good bowling this. An easy nudge through the leg side gives Warner and Australia two more to backward square
short of a length outside off, Head tries to go over midwicket but was clearly hurries for pace. Bunts to mid-on
full on middle and off, giving nothing away. Blocked
good length outside off, carved down to third man
over mid-of. Short of a length outside off, Warner tries to go over the top. Doesn't get all of it, but gets enough to clear mid-off. Plinks in the outfield. Splendid running gives Warner three
139 kph, nice lines on off. Steered to third man
132 kph, slow on middle and leg. Seemed like an offcutter. Worked towards square leg
131 kph, full outside off, pushed down to mid-off for a quick single.
134 kph, straying down leg, leading edge towards mid-on for one

good length on middle, Warner is hurried and gets hit on the thigh. The ball ricochets to point who unnecessarily fires a throw at the non-strikers end. Concedes the overthrow. If you're good at saving runs, have to be able to prevent these kind of runs too. Fine margins in this sport
strays down leg this time, wide. Very surprised this is the line Phehlukwayo has stuck to
another one. The bowler is not happy. Overpitched outside off, driven straight to Miller at cover who fires a throw, hits the stumps at the strikers end and concedes one. Two extra runs in this over.
good length on middle, whipped past midwicket for two. Nice shot, immense power in those wrists
goes through and that's four. Overpitched on middle and leg, Head finds the gap at midwicket, past mid-on too.
four more! Warner doing nothing wrong. May not have been picking him so he opts to reverse sweep. Gets this in between two fielders for four
97 kph, flat on middle. Flat-batted to midwicket for one
slow legbreak on off, Head outside-edges towards short third man for one. Playing him nicely
82 kph, slow on middle. Cut to short third again, the pair are hesitant but rightly, decide against the run
fantastic batting. Nudged towards midwicket for one
slow down leg, clipped to square leg. They'll take what they can
good length outside off, pushed towards cover for a quick run
strays down leg, worked towards short fine leg
superb shot, superb fielding. Overpitched outside off, cracked through towards cover. Miller dives and prevents the ball from going through
good length outside off, 137 kph. Shovelled to long-on. Happy to take the singles.
142.6 kph outside off. Head crunches his drive to cover on the bounce
good over from Steyn. Just four off. Full on middle and leg, Head misses his flick and is struck on the pad
slow through the air on middle and off, Warner gets low to reverse lap. Misses. Struck on the body

big appeal, Tahir wants a review. Faf has a look at Qdk and opts to review. Only question here is if it was pitching in line? Looked like it did, but hit Warner on the thigh. A flat delivery on leg, Warner gets low to sweep but misses. The ball carries on and hits Warner on the thigh, two leg byes to fine leg, the result. All on hawkeye now. Yikes, pitched just outside leg. Excellent decision from umpire George.
flat and wide outside off, cut out to deep cover
the googly outside off, 84 kph. Drilled down to long-off
another googly outside off, cut out to point. Phehlukwayo dives and prevents the ball from going through
flight outside off, driven out towards cover
a slower delivery on middle, bunted down to long-on. 120 kph, Steyn has varied his pace nicely despite not extracting much

picks the length early. To be fair, wasn't nearly short enough ti pull. But Head was hanging back, gets the length he wanted and slaps his pull in the gap at midwicket. There's the boundary for the over
drifts down leg, Head picks out square leg with his flick
full and wide from around the wicket. 137 kph. Skids on and beats Head's cut
good stop. Overpitched outside off, pushed down towards mid-off who saves the boundary, parries it to long-on and allows the second run
beauty to finish. 139 kph, good length outside off, zips through and beats the bat. Lovely over and effort from Steyn
flight on off, nice loop. Fiercely cut to deep point
flatter delivery on off, 87 kph. Defended. Good lines.
flipper, quick on off and middle. Pushed down to long-on. Nice from Tahir, staying accurate

superb shot, that should be four. It is. Overpitched outside off, Warner gives himself room by staying leg side of the ball and then smashes his drive past cover. Duminy gets across from long-off but can't cut it in. Makes contact while touching the boundary
the legspinner outside off, spins back in and cuts the batsman in half
wrong un, pushed to over. A misfield and a parry allows two

not all that short to pull but Head had decided he was going to go for it anyway, looked to fetch it from outside off too, and all he managed in the top was a top edge. It was swirling around for a long, long time but De Kock called nice and early, kept his eyes on it all along till he saw it lodge into his gloves.

slapped to point where a half-stop jeeps it down to a single. Faf is withering in pain. Has he damaged his finger? He seems in severe pain. Faf was off balance when the ball took off from one of the patches and smashed into his finger.
runs it down to third man to get off the mark immediately
uses the pace of the bowler to steer it down to third man again
floats this into the pads, worked to deep midwicket
yorker-length delivery outside off, Warner stays deep inside the crease to squeeze it wide of cover
too full on the pads, whipped to deep square leg
gets across the stumps and paddles it to short fine. Lucky to get away with that high full toss. Faf tumbled over and then crawled to get to the ball
driven down to long-off as they amble the single
touch short, Warner makes room and cuts that to deep point
down one one knee as he plays a half-sweep to square leg. Couldn't generate much power on that occasion
cuts that to Rabada at deep point
swings over cover, ball flies off the thick outside edge to the third man boundary. At this stage, no one's bothered about aesthetics.
backs away and slaps one behind point to third man
gets on top of the bounce and eases it off the back foot to deep point, the boundary rider comes haring in to keep that down to a single

excellent yorker, Warner looks to back away and squeeze it behind point but Abbott bowls this full and just outside off, didn't have the kind of room he would have liked as he digs it out towards the cover region
gets a big nick that is gleefully accepted by De Kock. This was a short of length delivery outside off, Wade went for a big swipe across the line but the extra bounce did him in.
the ball reverses back in a long way to beat his flick and hit him on the pad
backs away and carves a full delivery over the infield, to deep cover

as far as catches go, it can't get easier than that. Pacy length ball that holds up after pitching outside off, Mennie looks to loft through the line but hit it straight down the throat of Miller at mid-off. He impressed with the ball, but the outing with the bat has been anything but that

delightfully done by Warner. Goes outside leg stump and then unfurls those wrists to pick the gap behind point. Deep cover was sprinting across, but could only get his finger tips upon a dive. Tahir the fielder in question
floats this full and down leg, all Warner needed was a fine tickle to get a boundary, missed out
another slower delivery gone wrong, way down leg side. De Kock collects on the bounce
so, so clever. This time he takes it on the full and then slices it behind point. There were three men on the off side ring, but he still picked the gap.
walks across the stumps and squeezes it to mid-off for a quick single
gets right underneath that yorker outside off to keep it out

gets a thick inside edge onto the pad as he backs away to slash. The deflection nearly rolls onto the stumps.  Brings up his 150  Muted celebrations, but I'm sure it will be anything but that should he take the side past the line
beaten outside off by a delivery that deviates away from the length area outside off

what athleticism from Faf! Outstanding work to effect a run-out. In the end, Tremain has sacrificed his wicket. He got a thick inside edge towards midwicket where Phehlukwayo intially looked for an under-arm flick as the bowler was still on his followthrough. Faf wasn't even in the picture even as the flick came in. But he dived full-length across to nearly dive into the stumps. But he ensured he disturbed them only when he was fully in control of the ball. Top, top work
dabs it wide of point and scampers through for a quick single
tucked to midwicket as they steal another single
full and sliding into middle and leg, he wrists it to deep midwicket
right into the block hole, Warner backs away and carves it past the infield. Somehow, he found a way to squeeze that with immense power. Super stuff this. Tahir at deep cover had no chance
third man was inside the ring. What does Warner do?Make room, arch back and ramp the ball over him. Rabada slowed it down just a touch but the width was manufactured to find the boundary. Sensational
angles a yorker-length delivery on the pads, worked into the gap at deep backward square leg
sliding into the pads, gentle flick of the wrists to get that behind square on the leg side. No one at fine leg. So once he got enough bat on it, that was headed just one way
low full toss that has been fllicked to deep square
bouncer but the direction is wrong. Slides it down leg as Tremain manages to avoid it
firm drive, straight to cover
thick outside edge down to third man, scampers back for the second. Looked to squeeze that behind point
he's clobbered that, or has he? Backs away and slashes that to get it into the gap towards square third man. For a minute, it looked like he'd smashed that, but ended up slicing it
flays the short ball angling in towards cover, made a bit of room to manufacture something out of nothing.
swing and a miss. How did that miss off stump, I don't know. Wild swing across the line but was beaten for pace.
over the stumps this time! Jags back in to beat the swing again.
backs away and lofts it up and over point, third man comes around to cut that off

Unfortunate end to a top, top knock. He simply had to come back for the second after carving that to deep cover, but the throw was right on top of the stumps from Tahir as de Kock gathered the ball cleanly and whipped the bails off. Newlands stand up to applaud a great innings.

firm push to mid-off, the throw misses the stumps and smashes into Boland's knee. He's liming now.  Ouch, he's in a lot of pain  The cameras panned to the Australian dressing room, and almost everyone was falling off their chair in laughter!
swings over midwicket, ends up slicing it down to third man
mistimes an attempted slog down to mid-on
backs away to squeeze that to deep point
makes room and drills it to deep cover
sees the batsman backing away and follows him by bowling it full outside leg, squeezed back past the bowler to mid-on
slower delivery way outside off, just toeing with the wide line

tucked towards deep midwicket, the throw comes in full and flat as Steyn collects it cleanly and whips the bails off. Perhaps Boland's hit on the knee may have slowed him down as he turned for the second.  Third umpire has two looks before deciding it's 5-0 for South Africa.
